demographics.diagnosis: Leg amputation (post-surgical PT) and contralateral leg wound care

clinical_logic.readiness_milestone: Completion of Physical Therapy (PT) goals and wound healing stabilization

environmental_logic.physical_barriers: Inaccessible home entry (stair barrier) requiring a wheelchair ramp for safe mobility
bureaucratic_steps: CHC Waiver application/approval for home modification
Obtaining three separate contractor estimates (Medicaid requirement)
Comparison and approval of specific contractor by CHC caseworker

timeline_deltas.context: Requirement for three estimates and bureaucratic approval cycles extended the stay significantly beyond clinical readiness.
Primary wound care provider contracted COVID-19, requiring coordination of a backup provider from a different region (Erie).

reasoning_trace_triples.situation: Patient/Family unwilling to pay $200+ out-of-pocket for rental ramp
reasoning_trace_triples.action_taken: Assisted in managing the CHC waiver timeline and expectations
reasoning_trace_triples.result: Patient remained in SNF for 90+ days to ensure 100% cost coverage by waiver

reasoning_trace_triples.situation: Wound Care Specialist unavailable due to COVID-19
reasoning_trace_triples.action_taken: Coordinated with established HHA (OSTPA) to cover dressing changes
reasoning_trace_triples.result: Patient safely discharged despite specialist delay; HHA saw patient within 24 hours

reasoning_trace_triples.situation: Initial SNF/Social Worker estimate of '2 weeks' was unrealistic
reasoning_trace_triples.result: Avoided premature HHA activation and preserved stakeholder trust

rank_1_best_practices.context: Specialist provider illness right before discharge
rank_1_best_practices.action: Leveraged existing relationship with HHA to bridge the clinical gap
rank_1_best_practices.rationale: Ensures wound integrity and patient comfort without delaying the hard-won discharge date.

rank_1_best_practices.context: Slow bureaucratic progress with CHC caseworker
rank_1_best_practices.action: Prioritized patient as the primary information source over the Social Worker
rank_1_best_practices.rationale: The patient had direct daily contact with the supports coordinator, providing higher fidelity data.

rank_0_boundary_failures.action: Assumed step-count and ramp needs were solely the domain of PT/Social Work
rank_0_boundary_failures.note: Navigator later realized this should be part of their own intake to prevent timeline surprises.

unscripted_chaos_signals: Regional specialist shortage (only one provider in the region)
Patient refusal of private-pay temporary solutions
